data.title: Noisy atmosphere but good food
data.text: Big, delicious burritos. Big, widely scattered flat screens for sports watching. Last night of the World Series with tables of families, single women, and of course guys. Nice place to eat...good food...but too loud for conversation.

data.title: Hard to beat this place
data.text: Fantastic food. The burritos are amazing. Get ready to be stuffed. Theyre huge! Homeade tortillias! Can even watch them bieng made! The food is high quality and the prices are fair. Tons of drink options too. This places is jumpin! A must stop place for me every chance I get!

data.title: Great Breakfast Joint
data.text: This place is great for breakfast.  They have lots of Mexican and American dishes to choose from.  Portions are large and the food was great.  They also have a full bar and have excellent prices on Mimosas.  They have a nice little patio out back.  If you want breakfast and a cocktail this is the place to be.

data.title: Burrito's as big as My Forearm!
data.text: Stopped in one night while on a surf trip and ordered the Cheese-steak Burrito and it was awesome. We sat at the outside bar where there are plenty of TV's to watch the game had a few drinks. The atmosphere was great, the service was fast and friendly and the food was wonderful. I will be eating and drinking here again when I come back to Carlsbad, CA.

data.title: Love! Love! Love!
data.text:
Me and my teenage daughter were staying a few days at the beach and one evening while walking around we found this place. At first lookthe curb appeal might turn some away because it's very low key and your not to sure about going in. But living in southern CA most of my life I know this usually means great food and an awesome atmosphere. I was right! The minute you walk in the guys greet you with a friendly smile and are ready to take your order. You start by ordering at the counter and then they bring it out to you. The food is fresh and so delicious! I got the chicken street tacos and rice. My daughter got the steak street tacos...two thumbs up!👍
We also got the chips that came out hot and fresh. We loved the natural sodas and salsa bar rocks!
I will warn you to order the small chips or fries because they are huge orders.
We loved it so much this was our dinner stop each night.

data.title: Grubby
data.text:
We went here hoping for one of those Mexican places that looks like a dive but has great food.  The reviews suggested that was the case.
WRONG!
This place is well named- grubby.  
If you are looking for a restaurant with metal utensils, plates, waitresses and serious Mexican food, don't go here.  
Burritos were soggy- no, REALLY soggy.  The Cheesesteak burrito had no resemblance to Mexican food. My wife had a burrito she describes as a bad Greek Gyro with soggy French fires, mango slices and ineptly flavored pork.   
Apparently the locals like this place based on reviews, but I would STAY AWAY.

data.title: Casually satisfying Mexican
data.text:
The food itself was good, made more so because we were all very hungry after cycling 100+ miles from LA. The service was a little sluggish and definitely unreliable; both of our orders of chips and guacamole were instead chips and beans until we corrected them.

It wasn't all bad service though. One of us only got charged for one beer at the bar even though he ordered three.

data.title: California Burritos to die for
data.text: My favorite Cali burrito to date, so good! Great vibe, service was goodish. Wife wasn't a fan of the chips but I would drive a long ways for the CB.

data.title: Great vibes n food
data.text: I love the al pastor tacos!! Very authentic !! Excellent hot hats Salsas very spicy. Also kid friendly menu. Very friendly staff. Got an Aztec discount !! Definitely will go back !!

data.title: Tacvo's are very good
data.text: We went there on a food tour and had an amazing Taco. I will be returning to sample other items on there menu

data.title: Good food and plenty of it!
data.text: We enjoy coming here for breakfast. Love the salsa/chile bar. We have ordered the bif breakfast burritos, chorizo and eggs and have enjoyed everything we have eaten there. The place is super casual. You stand in line to place your order.

data.title: Unbelievable Breakfast! YUMMY!!
data.text: We enjoy visiting Senor Grubby's for breakfast when in Carlsbad. Huge portions and casual environment. Order at counter and find a seat....great beach vibe.

data.title: Tacos!
data.text: Damn good tacos. We had chicken and al pastor tacos and they were both quite good. The place is funky and usually crowded, so be prepared. Fine dining it ain't, but if you're looking for cold beer and great tacos, you're in the right place.

data.title: Great Food NO AIR CONDITIONING
data.text: This restaurant had great food. The service was not the best just very slow. You have to order at the counter and wait. It is very hot inside. There is no air conditioning. We took our food to go.

data.title: Best Food and service
data.text:
Great food! Cheap! 
Great and fun crew! Very clean place and bathroom, good beer! Good prices!  Very gently people working!! The atmosphere Makes me feel like home!

Rica comida! Barata! Fresca! La haven rápido! Muy limpios los baños, el equipo de trabajo es muy amoroso. 
La atmosfera del lugar me hace sentir como en casa!

100% recommend

data.title: Very good, not great
data.text:
First, expect placing your order at the register and eating on paper plates with plastic silverware.  Not a problem for us but thought you would like to know.

Very good Mexican dive kind of Taco shop but in a cool bar setting.

Refried beans are good.  Rice is good.  Tacos taste great and burritos are good.  Not outstanding food but it's good.

data.title: Yum.
data.text: Great place for breakfast! I have never been here, but my burrito was simply delish. I had a veggie burrito with eggs potatoes, guacamole, and sour cream. Let's not forget the tasty salsas at the salsa bar! I will be back to try the chilaquiles 😊

data.title: Delicious Mexican Grub
data.text: We had dinner here one evening at this low-key locals favorite, and were not disappointed.  Food was excellent.  The following day, we tried to get in for breakfast at a couple restaurants and were faced with long wait times.  Back to Grubby's we went and, again, were pleased.  Homemade tortilla chips are great, with a variety of salsas available in the salsa bar.  Ceviche is fresh and delicious.

data.title: Great breakfast burritos!
data.text: The breakfast burritos are awesome! If you are looking to be waited on, you won't get it here because it's an "order at the counter" place. Many beers on tap and options for kids too!

data.title: Senor Grubby's
data.text: Convenient location in the Village. Food here is your average everyday run of the mill Mexican variety food. Plenty of choices of adult beverages. Nothing special about the ambiance. i found the help there to be a bit ambivalent and not that friendly. Overall experience was average.
